column4: So anyone else have any ideas regarding laggy window-dragging @ 11.10 ?
Is my name freenode?....
yes
there's lots of options besides unity. GNOME3, KDE, XFCE, LXDE, etc.
all of those have their own ubuntu-tweaked versions that are pretty awesome. I used xfce (xubuntu)
ok what is the default one that was before unity was implementeD?
the default was gnome 2
but gnome 2 is no longer maintained, for the most part. You might want to try gnome 3.
ok, what about xfce? what's the difference? (I'm all about smooth, organized workflow and window management).
they're just different in little ways. XFCE doesn't have a 3-part menu like gnome 2 did ('places' and such), it has a more start menu-type thing, etc.
You can set it up to be almost exactly the same as gnome 2
with small differences
mmkaay. sudo command for that? :P
I agree with dr_willis. Try out several.
the... cleanest way to try them out is to install ubuntu on a virtual machine (virtualbox), but playing with your main installation is also an option :)
sudo apt-get install gnome-shell? :P
awesomeness guys, gonna try gnome-shell. this will install Gnome 3 or whatever, right?
pretty much
unity is built on top of most of gnome 3. Gnome shell is the bit that unity replaces.
So I already have gnome3? o.O
I just did terminal command and it didn't say I already have it.. if it ever says that though.
Just as a warning, people who like gnome 2 often say they prefer xfce to unity/gnome3 shell. I recommend trying everything :)
